jsoul.midi

Class Sequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsoul.midi.Sequence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Playable

    public class Sequence
extends java.lang.Object
implements Playable
    Represents a MIDI sequence, comprised of several layered Tracks, each containing some subsequence of notes and chords.
    Author:
    Andrew Goldin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sequence()
      Default constructor.
      Sequence(Track... t)
      Constructs a new sequence by layering the provided Tracks, at 120 BPM.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Track t)
      Adds a new Track to the Sequence.
      void clear()
      Clears and deletes all tracks in the sequence, and resets the sequence to 120 BPM.
      javax.sound.midi.Sequence createMidiSequence()
      Converts the jsoul sequence into a standard javax.sound.midi.Sequence.
      int getNumTracks()
      Returns the number of tracks in the sequence.
      float getTempo()
      Returns the sequence tempo, in beats per minute
      Track getTrack(int n)
      Gets a specifed track in the sequence.
      Track[] getTracks()
      Gets the tracks in the sequence.
      void removeTrack(int trackNum)
      Removes a specified track.
      void setTempoInBPM(float tempoBPM)
      Sets the tempo of the sequence, in beats per minute.
      void setTrack(int trackNum, Track t)
      Sets a particular track in the Sequence.
      void setTracks(Track... t)
      Reset all tracks in the sequence.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the sequence, including the number of tracks, tempo, and the String representation of each Track.
      void transpose(int steps)
      Transposes all notes and Chords in all tracks of the sequence.

        public void clear()
        Clears and deletes all tracks in the sequence, and resets the sequence to 120 BPM.
